title: Victoria Coren Mitchell on TV - 'Perhaps we have neglected the traditional ritual of social integration: mindless collective staring at the telly'
text:
Driving along the M40 the other day, I heard the strangest advert for ITV on the radio.

It began by revealing that anxiety and depression in British children has risen 48 per cent in the last 15 years. It went on to explain that “talking to each other” is vital to addressing and curing this problem.

“So, tonight, while watching ITV,” recommended the advert, “why not chat to your family? Tune back in to the story in your living room.”

This is a nice idea. Of course we should rediscover our instincts and ability to converse. It would be an excellent campaign for almost any major brand to get behind. A drinks company, say, or a biscuit company. Or a supermarket or a restaurant chain. Or a train...
